VMware NSX for vSphere API documentation version 6.1.4

https://{nsxmanager}/api

vdsManage

This collection of methods are used to configure and prepare the VDS's for the use with NSX

vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches post get

post

prepares a pre-configured vds with teaming and MTU options, MTU must be 1600 or higher

get

Lists all vds's

post vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches

prepares a pre-configured vds with teaming and MTU options, MTU must be 1600 or higher

Secured by basic
  • Request

Body

Type: application/xml

Schema:

<vdsContext>
    <switch>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    </switch>
    <teaming></teaming>
    <mtu></mtu>
</vdsContext>

get vdsManage /2.0/vdn/switches

Lists all vds's

Secured by basic

    vdsInDc /datacenter/{datacenterID} get

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    get

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    get vdsInDc /2.0/vdn/switches/datacenter/{datacenterID}

    Lists all VDS's in a specified vSphere Datacenter Object

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • datacenterID: required (string)

      A valid Datacenter Id (e.g. datacenter-4)

    vds /{vdsId} get delete

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    get

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    delete

    Delete a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    get vds /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

    Retrieve a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • switchId: required (string)

      A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

    delete vds /2.0/vdn/switches/{vdsId}

    Delete a specific vds by specific switchId (e.g. dvs-26)

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    URI Parameters

    • switchId: required (string)

      A valid switch (VDS) Id (e.g. dvs-26)

    vdnConfig

    Configurations of Segment ID's and Multicast Ranges for logical switches

    vdnSegmentPools /segments post get

    Operations on Segment ID's (VXLAN Idd)

    post

    Add a segment ID Pool

    get

    Lists all Segment ID Pools

    post vdnSegmentPools /2.0/vdn/config/segments

    Add a segment ID Pool

    Secured by basic
    • Request

    Body

    Type: application/xml

    Schema:

    <segmentRange>
    <name></name>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
</segmentRange>

    get vdnSegmentPools /2.0/vdn/config/segments

    Lists all Segment ID Pools

    Secured by basic

      vdnSegmentPool /{segmentPoolId} get put delete

      Operations on individual segment ID Pool

      get

      Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool

      put

      Update an individual segment ID Pool

      delete

      Delete an individual segment ID Pool

      get vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Retrieve details of an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      put vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Update an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      Body

      Type: application/xml

      Schema:

      <segmentRange>
	<end></end>
    <name></name>
</segmentRange>

      delete vdnSegmentPool /2.0/vdn/config/segments/{segmentPoolId}

      Delete an individual segment ID Pool

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      URI Parameters

      • segmentPoolId: required (string)

        A valid segment Pool Id

      vdnMulticastPools /multicasts post get

      Operations on multicast range Pools for logical switches

      post

      Adds a multicast range for logical switches

      get

      List all configured vdn Multicast Pools

      post vdnMulticastPools /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

      Adds a multicast range for logical switches

      Secured by basic
      • Request

      Body

      Type: application/xml

      Schema:

      <multicastRange>
    <name></name>
    <desc></desc>
    <begin></begin>
    <end></end>
</multicastRange>

      get vdnMulticastPools /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts

      List all configured vdn Multicast Pools

      Secured by basic

        vdnMulticastPool /{multicastAddresssRangeId} get put delete

        Operations in individual multicast range Pools for logical switches

        get

        Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

        put

        Update an individual Multicast range Pool

        delete

        Delete an individual Multicast range Pool

        get vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Retrieve details of an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        put vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Update an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        Body

        Type: application/xml

        Schema:

        <multicastRange>
    <name>name</name>
    <desc>desc</desc>
    <end>239.3.3.3</end>
</multicastRange>

        delete vdnMulticastPool /2.0/vdn/config/multicasts/{multicastAddresssRangeId}

        Delete an individual Multicast range Pool

        Secured by basic
        • Request

        URI Parameters

        • multicastAddresssRangeId: required (string)

          A valid multicast Pool range Id

        vdnConfigUDP /vxlan/udp/port get

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        get

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        get vdnConfigUDP /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port

        View configured UDP port for VXLAN

        Secured by basic

          vdnConfigUDPUpdate /{portNumber} put

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          put

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          put vdnConfigUDPUpdate /2.0/vdn/config/vxlan/udp/port/{portNumber}

          Updates the UDP Port used for VXLAN

          Secured by basic
          • Request

          URI Parameters

          • portNumber: required (string)

            A valid UDP Port for VXLAN

          allocatedResources /resources/allocated get

          Query allocated resources

          get

          Retrieve a list of resources allocated

          get allocatedResources /2.0/vdn/config/resources/allocated

          Retrieve a list of resources allocated

          Secured by basic
          • Request

          Query Parameters

          • type: (string)

            set to "segmentId" or "multicastAddress"

          • pagesize: (string)

            Optional; limits the maximum number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024, default is 256

          • startindex: (string)

            Optional; specifies the starting point for retrieval. If not specified, resources are retrieved from the beginning

          vdnScopes

          Read all scopes (transport zones), or create a new scope (Transport Zone)

          vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes get post

          get

          Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes

          post

          Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ.

          get vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes

          Retrieve a list of all known VDN Scopes

          Secured by basic

            post vdnScopes /2.0/vdn/scopes

            Create a new Transport Zone. Note that you can only add one initial cluster when creating the TZ.

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <name></name>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
    <description></description>
</vdnScope>

            vdnScope /{scopeId} get post delete

            Read, update and delete an existing scope (transport Zone)

            get

            Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

            post

            Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone

            delete

            delete a transport zone

            get vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            Retrieve the properties of an existing network scope

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            post vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            Updates a transport zone, you can add a cluster to or delete a cluster from a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Query Parameters

            • action: required (string)

              Mandatory queryParameter, use 'expand' to add a cluster, or 'shrink' to remove a cluster from the TZ

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
</vdnScope>

            delete vdnScope /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}

            delete a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            vdnScopeAttribUpdate /attributes put

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            put

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            put vdnScopeAttribUpdate /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/attributes

            update the attributes of a transport zone (e.g. Name, description)

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <vdnScope>
    <clusters>
        <cluster>
            <cluster>
                <objectId></objectId>
            </cluster>
        </cluster>
    </clusters>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</vdnScope>

            vdnScopeConnCheck /conn-check/multicast post

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            post

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            post vdnScopeConnCheck /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/conn-check/multicast

            Test multicast group connectivity in a transport zone

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            logicalSwitches

            Create and List operations of logical switches inside a Transport Zone (scope)

            logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires get post

            get

            Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

            post

            creates a logicalSwitch

            get logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

            Lists all logical Switches in the Transport Zone (Scope)

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            post logicalSwitches /2.0/vdn/scopes/{scopeId}/virtualwires

            creates a logicalSwitch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • scopeId: required (string)

              A valid scope Id

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <virtualWireCreateSpec>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <tenantId></tenantId>
    <controlPlaneMode></controlPlaneMode>
</virtualWireCreateSpec>

            logicalSwitchesGlobal

            List Operations of logicalSwitches in all transport Zones (scope)

            logicalSwitchesGlobal /2.0/vdn/virtualwires get

            get

            List all logicalSwitches

            get logicalSwitchesGlobal /2.0/vdn/virtualwires

            List all logicalSwitches

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Query Parameters

            • startIndex: (string)

              optional; specify starting point for retrieving logical switches

            • pageSize: (string - default: 20)

              optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

            logicalSwitchVmAttach /vm/vnic get

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            get

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            get logicalSwitchVmAttach /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/vm/vnic

            Migrate a Virtual Maschine vnic to a logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <com.vmware.vshield.vsm.inventory.dto.VnicDto>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <vnicUuid></vnicUuid>
    <portgroupId></portgroupId>
</com.vmware.vshield.vsm.inventory.dto.VnicDto>

            logicalSwitch /{virtualWireID} get put delete

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            get

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            put

            Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

            delete

            Delete a logical switch

            get logicalSwitch /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Retrieves the configuration of an individual logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            put logicalSwitch /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Update a logical switch, possible updates are name changes & Controlplane Mode

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            delete logicalSwitch /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}

            Delete a logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            logicalSwitchConnCheck /conn-check/multicast post

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            post

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            post logicalSwitchConnCheck /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/multicast

            Test multicast group connectivity in logical switch

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <testParameters>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
    <packetSize></packetSize>
    <sourceHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </sourceHost>
    <destinationHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </destinationHost>
</testParameters>

            logicalSwitchPing /conn-check/p2p post

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            post

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            post logicalSwitchPing /2.0/vdn/virtualwires/{virtualWireID}/conn-check/p2p

            Perform point to point connectivity test between two hosts across which a logical switch spans

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • virtualWireID: required (string)

              A logical switch id, e.g. virtualwire-1002

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <testParameters>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <packetSizeMode></packetSizeMode>
    <packetSize></packetSize>
    <sourceHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </sourceHost>
    <destinationHost>
        <hostId></hostId>
        <switchId></switchId>
        <vlanId></vlanId>
    </destinationHost>
</testParameters>

            arpMAC

            Working with ARP suppression and MAC learning for logical switches

            arpMAC /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features get put

            get

            Query ARP suppression and MAC learning information

            put

            Enable or disable ARP suppression and MAC learning

            get arpMAC /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features

            Query ARP suppression and MAC learning information

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • ID: required (string)

              dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

            put arpMAC /2.0/xvs/networks/{ID}/features

            Enable or disable ARP suppression and MAC learning

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            URI Parameters

            • ID: required (string)

              dvpg MoID or virtual wire ID

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <networkFeatureConfig>
    <ipDiscoveryConfig>
        <enabled></enabled>
    </ipDiscoveryConfig>
    <macLearningConfig>
        <enabled></enabled>
    </macLearningConfig>
</networkFeatureConfig>

            nsxControllers

            Working with NSX controllers

            nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller post get

            post

            Add a new controller on a specified cluster. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster

            get

            Retrieve details and runtime status for all controllers

            post nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller

            Add a new controller on a specified cluster. Request without body to upgrade controller cluster

            Secured by basic
            • Request

            Body

            Type: application/xml

            Schema:

            <controllerSpec>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <ipPoolId></ipPoolId>
    <resourcePoolId></resourcePoolId>
    <hostId></hostId>
    <datastoreId></datastoreId>
    <deployType></deployType>
    <networkId></networkId>
    <password></password>
</controllerSpec>

            get nsxControllers /2.0/vdn/controller

            Retrieve details and runtime status for all controllers

            Secured by basic

              nsxControllerUpgradeAvailability /upgrade-available get

              Query controller upgrade availability

              get

              Query controller upgrade availability

              get nsxControllerUpgradeAvailability /2.0/vdn/controller/upgrade-available

              Query controller upgrade availability

              Secured by basic

                nsxControllerJob /progress/{jobId} get

                Status of controller creation or removal

                get

                Retrieve status of controller creation or removal. Returns percentage indication of job progress

                get nsxControllerJob /2.0/vdn/controller/progress/{jobId}

                Retrieve status of controller creation or removal. Returns percentage indication of job progress

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • jobId: required (string)

                  Specified job Id

                nsxController /{controllerId} delete

                Working with specified controller

                delete

                Delete NSX controller. When deleting last controller from cluster, forceRemoval must be set to true

                delete nsxController /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}

                Delete NSX controller. When deleting last controller from cluster, forceRemoval must be set to true

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                Query Parameters

                • forceRemoval: required (boolean)

                  Force removal of controller (true/false)

                nsxControllerLogs /techsupportlogs get

                Controller logs

                get

                Retrieve controller logs

                get nsxControllerLogs /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/techsupportlogs

                Retrieve controller logs

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                nsxControllerSyslog /syslog post get delete

                Syslog exporter on controller node

                post

                Add controller syslog exporter on the controller

                get

                Retrieve details about the syslog exporter on the controller

                delete

                Delete the syslog exporter

                post nsxControllerSyslog /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Add controller syslog exporter on the controller

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                Body

                Type: application/xml

                Schema:

                <controllerSyslogServer>
    <syslogServer></syslogServer>
    <port></port>
    <protocol></protocol>
    <level></level>
</controllerSyslogServer>

                get nsxControllerSyslog /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Retrieve details about the syslog exporter on the controller

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                delete nsxControllerSyslog /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/syslog

                Delete the syslog exporter

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                nsxControllerSnapshot /snapshot get

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                get

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                get nsxControllerSnapshot /2.0/vdn/controller/{controllerId}/snapshot

                Take a snapshot of the control cluster from the specified controller node

                Secured by basic
                • Request

                URI Parameters

                • controllerId: required (string)

                  Specified controller

                nsxControllerCluster /cluster get put

                Cluster configuration

                get

                Retrieve cluster-wise configuration information for controller

                put

                Modify cluster configuration information for controller

                get nsxControllerCluster /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

                Retrieve cluster-wise configuration information for controller

                Secured by basic

                  put nsxControllerCluster /2.0/vdn/controller/cluster

                  Modify cluster configuration information for controller

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <controllerConfig>
    <sslEnabled></sslEnabled>
</controllerConfig>

                  nsxControllerPassword /credential put

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  put

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  put nsxControllerPassword /2.0/vdn/controller/credential

                  Change the NSX controller password

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  nsxControllerPasswordUpdate

                  servicesScope

                  Working with services on a scope

                  servicesScope /2.0/services/application/{scopeId} get post

                  get

                  List services that have been created on the scope

                  post

                  Create a new service on the specified scope

                  get servicesScope /2.0/services/application/{scopeId}

                  List services that have been created on the scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    Can be globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

                  post servicesScope /2.0/services/application/{scopeId}

                  Create a new service on the specified scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    Can be globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases.

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <application>
    <objectId/>
    <type>
        <typeName/>
    </type>
    <description>mandatory</description>
    <name>mandatory</name>
    <revision>0</revision>
    <objectTypeName/>
    <element>
        <applicationProtocol>mandatory</applicationProtocol>
        <value>mandatory</value>
    </element>
</application>

                  service

                  Working with a specified service

                  service /2.0/services/application/{applicationId} get put delete

                  get

                  Retrieve details about the specified service

                  put

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

                  delete

                  Delete the specified service

                  get service /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Retrieve details about the specified service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  put service /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <application>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <element>
        <applicationProtocol></applicationProtocol>
        <value></value>
    </element>
</application>

                  delete service /2.0/services/application/{applicationId}

                  Delete the specified service

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationId: required (string)

                    Specified as returned by a servicesScope POST call

                  Query Parameters

                  • force: (boolean)

                    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

                  applicationgroup

                  Operations on Application Groups

                  serviceGroups /{scopeId} post get

                  Working with service groups

                  post

                  Create a new service group on the specified scope

                  get

                  Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

                  post serviceGroups /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{scopeId}

                  Create a new service group on the specified scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <applicationGroup>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</applicationGroup>

                  get serviceGroups /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{scopeId}

                  Retrieve a list of service groups that have been created on the scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  serviceGroup /{applicationgroupId} get put delete

                  Working with an individual service group

                  get

                  Retrieve details about a service group

                  put

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

                  delete

                  Delete a service group from a scope

                  get serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Retrieve details about a service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  put serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Modify the name, description, applicationProtocol, or port value of a service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <applicationGroup>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <description></description>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <scope>
        <id></id>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <name></name>
    </scope>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
    <member>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </member>
</applicationGroup>

                  delete serviceGroup /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}

                  Delete a service group from a scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  Query Parameters

                  • force: (boolean)

                    Indicates if the delete should be forced or unforced. The default is unforced (false)

                  serviceGroupMembers /members/{moref} put delete

                  Add or delete service group members

                  put

                  Add a member to the service group

                  delete

                  Delete a member from the service group

                  put serviceGroupMembers /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

                  Add a member to the service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  • moref: required (string)

                    Management object reference to the member

                  delete serviceGroupMembers /2.0/services/applicationgroup/{applicationgroupId}/members/{moref}

                  Delete a member from the service group

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • applicationgroupId: required (string)

                    Application group ID

                  • moref: required (string)

                    Management object reference to the member

                  serviceGroupMembersRead /scope/{scopeId}/members get

                  Get the members of a service group

                  get

                  Get a list of member elements that can be added to the service groups created on a particular scope.

                  get serviceGroupMembersRead /2.0/services/applicationgroup/scope/{scopeId}/members

                  Get a list of member elements that can be added to the service groups created on a particular scope.

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  ipPools

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId} get post

                  get

                  Read all IP Pools in a scope

                  post

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  get ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

                  Read all IP Pools in a scope

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  post ipPools /2.0/services/ipam/pools/scope/{scopeId}

                  Create a pool of IP addresses

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • scopeId: required (string)

                    globalroot-0 or datacenterId in upgrade use cases

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipamAddressPool>
    <name></name>
    <prefixLength></prefixLength>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
    <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
    <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
    <ipRanges>
        <ipRangeDto>
            <startAddress></startAddress>
            <endAddress></endAddress>
        </ipRangeDto>
    </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

                  ipPool

                  Working with a specified IP pool

                  ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId} get put delete

                  get

                  Retrieve details about the IP pool

                  put

                  Modify an IP pool

                  delete

                  Delete an IP pool

                  get ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Retrieve details about the IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  put ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Modify an IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipamAddressPool>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <extendedAttributes></extendedAttributes>
    <prefixLength></prefixLength>
    <gateway></gateway>
    <dnsSuffix></dnsSuffix>
    <dnsServer1></dnsServer1>
    <dnsServer2></dnsServer2>
    <ipRanges>
        <ipRangeDto>
            <id></id>
            <startAddress></startAddress>
            <endAddress></endAddress>
        </ipRangeDto>
    </ipRanges>
</ipamAddressPool>

                  delete ipPool /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}

                  Delete an IP pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  ipPoolAllocate /ipaddresses get post

                  Work with IP's and their allocation status in IP Pools

                  get

                  Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

                  post

                  Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

                  get ipPoolAllocate /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

                  Retrieve all IP's and their allocation status in an IP Pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  post ipPoolAllocate /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses

                  Allocate an IP Address from the pool. Use 'ALLOCATE' in the 'allocationMode' field in the body to allocate the next available ip. To allocate a specific one use 'RESERVE' and pass the IP to reserve in the 'ipAddress' fiels in the body

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  Body

                  Type: application/xml

                  Schema:

                  <ipAddressRequest>
    <allocationMode></allocationMode>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
</ipAddressRequest>

                  ipAddressRelease /{ipAddress} delete

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  delete

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  delete ipAddressRelease /2.0/services/ipam/pools/{poolId}/ipaddresses/{ipAddress}

                  Release an IP Address allocation in the Pool

                  Secured by basic
                  • Request

                  URI Parameters

                  • poolId: required (string)

                    Specified IP pool

                  • ipAddress: required (string)

                    The Id of the ip address to release, e.g. '192.168.10.10'

                    ssoConfig

                    Operations on NSX Manager SSO registration

                    ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig get post delete

                    get

                    Query SSO Details

                    post

                    Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

                    delete

                    Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration

                    get ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                    Query SSO Details

                    Secured by basic

                      post ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                      Register NSX Manager to SSO Services

                      Secured by basic
                      • Request

                      Body

                      Type: application/xml

                      Schema:

                      <ssoConfig>
    <ssoLookupServiceUrl></ssoLookupServiceUrl>
    <ssoAdminUsername></ssoAdminUsername>
    <ssoAdminUserpassword></ssoAdminUserpassword>
    <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
</ssoConfig>

                      delete ssoConfig /2.0/services/ssoconfig

                      Deletes the NSX Manager SSO Configuration

                      Secured by basic

                        ssoStatus /status get

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        get

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        get ssoStatus /2.0/services/ssoconfig/status

                        Query the SSO configuration status of NSX Manager

                        Secured by basic

                          userMgmt

                          User Management Operations

                          userMgmtUser /user/{userId} get delete

                          Manage users

                          get

                          Get information about a user

                          delete

                          Remove the NSX role for a vCenter user

                          get userMgmtUser /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId}

                          Get information about a user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user ID

                          delete userMgmtUser /2.0/services/usermgmt/user/{userId}

                          Remove the NSX role for a vCenter user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user ID

                          userRoleMgmt /role/{userId} get post put delete

                          Manage roles for users

                          get

                          Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

                          post

                          Add role and resources for a user

                          put

                          Change a user's role

                          delete

                          Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

                          get userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Retrieve a user's role (possible roles are super_user, vshield_admin, enterprise_admin, security_admin, and audit)

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          post userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Add role and resources for a user

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          Query Parameters

                          • isGroup: required (boolean)

                            Set to "true" to apply to a group; set to "false" to apply to an individual user

                          Body

                          Type: application/xml

                          Schema:

                          <accessControlEntry>
    <role></role>
    <resource>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

                          put userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Change a user's role

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          Body

                          Type: application/xml

                          Schema:

                          <accessControlEntry>
    <role></role>
    <resource>
        <resourceId></resourceId>
    </resource>
</accessControlEntry>

                          delete userRoleMgmt /2.0/services/usermgmt/role/{userId}

                          Delete the role assignment for specified vCenter user. Once this role is deleted, the user is removed from NSX Manager. You cannot delete the role for a local user.

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • userId: required (string)

                            user to retrieve role information from

                          userMgmtState /enablestate/{value} put

                          Change the state of a user account (enabled/disabled)

                          put

                          Enable or disable a user account

                          put userMgmtState /2.0/services/usermgmt/enablestate/{value}

                          Enable or disable a user account

                          Secured by basic
                          • Request

                          URI Parameters

                          • value: required (integer)

                            value can be 0 to disable, or 1 to enable

                          userNSXManagerInfo /users/vsm get

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          get

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          get userNSXManagerInfo /2.0/services/usermgmt/users/vsm

                          Get information about users who have been assigned a NSX Manager role (local users as well as vCenter users with NSX Manager role)

                          Secured by basic

                            userMgmtRoles /roles get

                            NSX Manager user management operations on roles

                            get

                            Read all possible roles in NSX Manager

                            get userMgmtRoles /2.0/services/usermgmt/roles

                            Read all possible roles in NSX Manager

                            Secured by basic

                              userScopingObjects /scopingobjects get

                              Retrieve a list of objects that can be used to define a user's access scope

                                secGroup

                                Operations on securitygroups

                                secGroupGlobal /bulk/{scopeId} post

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                post

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                post secGroupGlobal /2.0/services/securitygroup/bulk/{scopeId}

                                Create a new security group on a global scope

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • scopeId: required (string)

                                  In the current version the scopeId will always be globalroot-0

                                Body

                                Type: application/xml

                                Schema:

                                <securitygroup>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
    <revision></revision>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <name></name>
    <scope>
        <id></id>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <name></name>
        <revision></revision>
    </scope>
    <clientHandle></clientHandle>
    <extendedAttributes/>
    <member>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <revision></revision>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </member>
    <excludeMember>
        <objectId></objectId>
        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
        <vsmUuid></vsmUuid>
        <revision></revision>
        <type>
            <typeName></typeName>
        </type>
        <name></name>
        <scope>
            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </excludeMember>
    <dynamicMemberDefinition>
        <dynamicSet>
            <operator></operator>
            <dynamicCriteria>
                <operator></operator>
                <key></key>
                <criteria></criteria>
                <value></value>
            </dynamicCriteria>
        </dynamicSet>
    </dynamicMemberDefinition>
</securitygroup>

                                secGroupBulkObject /bulk/{objectId} put

                                Update a specific security group

                                put

    </type>

        <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>

    </scope>

    <extendedAttributes/>
    <member>

            <typeName></typeName>

        </type>

            <id></id>
            <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
            <name></name>
        </scope>
        <clientHandle></clientHandle>
        <extendedAttributes/>
    </excludeMember>

                                secGroupInternal /internal/scope/{scopeId} get

                                Information on internal security groups

                                get

                                Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

                                get secGroupInternal /2.0/services/securitygroup/internal/scope/{scopeId}

                                Retrieve all internal security groups on the NSX Manager. These are used internally by the system and should not be created or modified by end users.

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • scopeId: required (string)

                                  Specified transport zone (scope)

                                ipset

                                Operations on IP Sets

                                ipsetList /scope/{scopeMoref} get

                                get

                                Retrieve all configured IPSets

                                get ipsetList /2.0/services/ipset/scope/{scopeMoref}

                                Retrieve all configured IPSets

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetScopeMoref: required (string)

                                  In the current version this scope-ref will always be globalroot-0

                                ipsetCreate /{scopeMoref} post

                                post

                                creates a new IPset

                                post ipsetCreate /2.0/services/ipset/{scopeMoref}

                                creates a new IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetScopeMoref: required (string)

                                  In the current version this scope-ref will always be globalroot-0

                                Body

                                Type: application/xml

                                Schema:

                                <ipset>
    <objectId></objectId>
    <type>
        <typeName></typeName>
    </type>
    <description></description>
    <name></name>
    <revision></revision>
    <objectTypeName></objectTypeName>
    <value></value>
    <inheritanceAllowed></inheritanceAllowed>
</ipset>

                                ipset /{ipsetId} get put delete

                                get

                                Retrieve an individual IPset

                                put

                                Modify an existing IPset

                                delete

                                delete an IPset

                                get ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                Retrieve an individual IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                put ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                Modify an existing IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                delete ipset /2.0/services/ipset/{ipsetId}

                                delete an IPset

                                Secured by basic
                                • Request

                                URI Parameters

                                • ipsetId: required (string)

                                  The IPset to be queried or changed

                                vCenterConfig

                                Configuring NSX Manager with vCenter Server

                                vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig get put

                                get

                                Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

                                put

                                Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

                                get vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

                                Get vCenter Server configuration details on NSX Manager

                                Secured by basic

                                  put vCenterConfig /2.0/services/vcconfig

                                  Synchronize NSX Manager with vCenter server

                                  Secured by basic
                                  • Request

                                  Body

                                  Type: application/xml

                                  Schema:

                                  <vcInfo>
    <ipAddress></ipAddress>
    <userName></userName>
    <password></password>
    <certificateThumbprint></certificateThumbprint>
    <assignRoleToUser></assignRoleToUser>
    <pluginDownloadServer></pluginDownloadServer>
    <pluginDownloadPort></pluginDownloadPort>
</vcInfo>

                                  vCenterStatus /status get

                                  Connection status for vCenter Server

                                  get

                                  Get default vCenter Server connection status

                                  get vCenterStatus /2.0/services/vcconfig/status

                                  Get default vCenter Server connection status

                                  Secured by basic

    </ntpServer>

    <timezone></timezone>
</timeSettings>

                                                                    applianceMgrBackupSettings /backuprestore/backupsettings get put delete

                                                                    Appliance Manager backup settings

                                                                    get

                                                                    Retrieve backup settings

                                                                    put

                                                                    Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

                                                                    delete

                                                                    Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

                                                                    get applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                    Retrieve backup settings

                                                                    Secured by basic

                                                                      put applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                      Configure backup on the Appliance Manager

                                                                      Secured by basic
                                                                      • Request

                                                                      Body

                                                                      Type: application/xml

                                                                      Schema:

                                                                      <backupRestoreSettings>
    <ftpSettings>
        <transferProtocol></transferProtocol>
        <hostNameIPAddress></hostNameIPAddress>
        <port></port>
        <userName></userName>
        <password></password>
        <backupDirectory></backupDirectory>
        <filenamePrefix></filenamePrefix>
        <passiveMode></passiveMode>
        <useEPRT></useEPRT>
        <useEPSV></useEPSV>
    </ftpSettings>
    <backupFrequency>
        <frequency></frequency>
        <dayOfWeek></dayOfWeek>
        <hourOfDay></hourOfDay>
        <minuteOfHour></minuteOfHour>
    </backupFrequency>
    <excludeTables>
        <excludeTable></excludeTable>
    </excludeTables>
</backupRestoreSettings>

                                                                      delete applianceMgrBackupSettings /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backupsettings

                                                                      Delete Appliance Manager backup configuration

                                                                      Secured by basic

                                                                        applianceMgrBackup /backuprestore/backup post

                                                                        On-demand backup

                                                                        post

                                                                        Backup NSX data on-demand

                                                                        post applianceMgrBackup /1.0/appliance-management/backuprestore/backup

                                                                        Secured by basic

                                                                          applianceMgrBackups /backuprestore/backups get

                                                                                systemEvents

                                                                                Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                systemEvents /2.0/systemevent get

                                                                                get

                                                                                Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                get systemEvents /2.0/systemevent

                                                                                Get NSX Manager system events

                                                                                Secured by basic
                                                                                • Request

                                                                                Query Parameters

                                                                                • startIndex: (string)

                                                                                  optional; specify starting point for retrieving the logs

                                                                                • pageSize: (string - default: 256)

                                                                                  optional; limit the max number of entries returned. Valid range is 1-1024

                                                                                auditLogs

                                                                                Get NSX Manager audit logs

                                                                                auditLogs /2.0/auditlog get

                                                                                get

                                                                                Get NSX Manager audit logs
